review_title: Work to serve a community that you can't afford to live in
job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Traverse City, MI
pros: Fulfilling work - helping patients Fun Team - although a lot of us have developed a fatalistic and grim sense of humor
cons: Patient to RN ratio - Not uncommon to have a 6:1 ratio Patient to NA ratio - Not uncommon to have a 20-30:1 ratio during the day and a 60:1 ratio (you read that correctly, SIXTY patients to ONE Nursing assistant) at night. Employees have been passing out because there isn't even enough time during some shifts to get a drink of water, let alone take a break without missing critical care components. Pay - Even with two members of my household as "Valued" employees, we can barely afford rent. We are barely over the limit to qualify for food stamps and, even with public assistance via WIC, we're seeing travelling employees coming in and getting paid almost double for those of us who are serving this community because it is OUR community Lack of training - not uncommon to be thrown on the floor during orientation due to lack of staff and patient ratios resulting in life-threatening mistakes for the patient Managerial Delusions of Grandeur - Touting things like "Munson is in the top 100 for teaching schools" Honestly, if Munson is a teaching school, I fear for those who need healthcare in the future. Staff is stretched too thin to even get all their daily tasks and care done let alone train someone else how to do it properly. Lack of Care for the Community - By continuing these unfair and UNSAFE labor practices, Munson Management is putting the community in danger - people can't receive the care that they deserve or need because Munson can't keep people on - it's not worth it for the pay and the mental anguish that employees are facing to continue to undervalue and underpay those who are directly caring for the members of the community MMC management is more concerned with putting lipstick on the pig that is Munson Healthcare. MMC has monopolized healthcare in northern Michigan and the employees and the communities are paying the price. Poor allocation/mismanagement of funds - Adding new OR suites that can't even take on additional patients due to lack of staff instead of paying people a living wage, adding new computers and big screen TVs to "assist" as opposed to figuring out a solution to the inability to actually retain people who can assist with the patients physical needs. I'd like to see how a television can help a surgical patient get out of bed to use the bathroom or go for a walk or bathe.

review_title: Don't work here if you have other options

review_title: A company that is not invested in staff development
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Traverse City, MI
pros: Traverse City has excellent recreational activities to enjoy outside of working hours. Munson Healthcare is a mid-sized northern Michigan healthcare system with a wide range of medical services and specialties provided.
cons:
MMC does not invest in it's staff members and does not pay a wage that reflects the cost of living in the area. MMC pays between 3-5 dollars lower than the starting average for new graduate nurses. It does not have a comprehensive development program for new graduates, and given their poor staffing and unwillingness to pay appropriate wages to both permanent staff and traveling RN's, MMC is short-staffed daily, with nurses carrying 20-40% greater case loads per shift, with no financial incentive to do so and no acknowledgement of the risk this places on staff members. 

I was offered 80$ hourly pay at a hospital system approx. 1.5 hours away. This was known by management. Their offer was not countered. My pay stayed at 29$ hourly. There was no negotiation in attempt to get me to stay on staff. This has affected previous co-workers tremendously as they have lost several nurses in a similar fashion, and nurse to patient ratios continue to worsen.

review_title: The company is here to make money off patients
job_title: Registered Nurse, ADN in Traverse City, MI
pros: Being a charge corporation they offer good benefits and streamline company policies so everyone gets the same stuff. When I trained they were implementing new training policies to allow for better training which seemed like it was in a good track. I don’t know if they are still using that policy. It seems like they have made so a very small number of new hires get this training through a internship for nurses but in order to get this training , after you have completed it you have to take any position they offer( nights) for a certain length of time which they say is six months but probably more like 1-2 years minimally.
cons: Everyone gets the same stuff no matter how hard you work. Departments don’t communicate with each other and frequent changes in administration mean big policies changes multiple times a year. In traverse city hospital will switch patients around so that the numbers look right, at least while they are transporting. Big one, nurse managers get bonuses or hiring recognition for being efficient and not calling in people, meaning you don’t get a break so they can look good. Also there is competition to look good to get the good units/shifts so atleast half the nurses punch out early and finish charting off the clock. Otherwise management checks into why your not keeping up with your charting and it’s not good. Patients are numbers and patient family’s get in the way of production so they are kept out of the units as much as possible.

job_title: Certified Home Health Aide in Gaylord, MI

To add injury to insult there is a lack of job competition in healthcare system abd therefore no need to offer competitive salary and benefit packages to local medical professionals and newly graduated professionals in the lower N. Lower MI region (TC to Cadillac, Kalkaska, Grayling, and Gaylord...)

Upper management does nothing to curtail horrendous management on some of the units. Non-union.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Traverse, MI
pros: the staff and the patients
cons: leadership in dept. and directors are criticizing, belittling  and  Ostracize Employees by gossiping about them and are not present, they sit at the coordinator desks and act very unprofessional. People can't say anything in fear of  being targeted. Management plays people against each other does not feel comfortable addressing their "friends". the GPTW surveys are a joke, management figures out who said what on the comments and tries to pit employees to revealing who they think said the  negative  comment(s). I've had one coordinator ask me straight out who I thought the negative comments came from. Staff are reluctant to be transparent for this reason. If we say all is well, then they leave us alone.

review_title: Good place to start as a nurse, little opportunities and crappy pay once you gain experience

pros: Nurses at the bedside were exceptional and taught me how to handle difficult situations; great teamwork; great patient outcomes; good tuition reimbursement
cons: Terrible management on the unit and from unit coordinators; cno is a joke and doesn't stand up for nurses; terrible pay and expect you to participate in extra work for minimal if any extra pay. Good place to start a nursing career but I don't think they have a good program to keep experienced nurses happy work everything they continue to take away/ridiculous expectations

review_title: I have worked here as an RN for 7+ years
job_title: Registered Nurse in Traverse City, MI
pros: Working three days per week.
cons: The pay for RN's is very low. It takes roughly 30 years to reach the top of the pay scale. The retirement benefits continually get cut and the cost of health insurance continues to increase despite less coverage/benefits.  The nurse to patient ratio is poor- I am often put in unsafe patient care assignments. I would not feel comfortable with my family being treated as a patient here. The upper level management continues to recieve bonuses 4x my income, yet our goal this year was to decrease the overall budget by 30%.

review_title: Not the same as it used to be
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Traverse City, MI

cons: Favoritism runs rampant, You get on the bad side of the wrong person and you'll find yourself looking for a new job. Pay isn't up to industry standards. To many projects, not enough people.

review_title: Good for IT folks that prefer zero communication with coworkers

review_title: Great non profit to work for

review_title: Optimal place to work if you are seasoned

job_title: in Traverse City, MI

cons: Managers that respect other managers (team leads and project managers) more than technical staff. Some managers openly do not listen to worker input, especially on technical issues. Workers that are openly incompetent. Workers that are in work avoidance mode (spending more energy to keep from doing something than they would just doing their job).

review_title: Logistics, not an important job at all judging by the compensation
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Traverse City, MI
pros: Great co-workers, good smelling food in cafeteria though my wage was never high enough to eat lunch.
cons: Wage is so pathetic that one full-time job is not enough to survive on unless you live in your car.  Most positions, like mine, pay slightly more than half the national average while the cost of living is high in Traverse City.  Definitely not the place to work if you need to make a living.

job_title: Administrative/Clerical in Traverse City, MI
pros:
Worked with some nice people
Fair benefits if you're there long enough.
cons:
Heavy workload, high stress.  Low pay.  The solution was to work more OT, not hire more people.  
Supervisor worked on a different floor and completely out of touch.  Allowed a bully coworker to control everything.  Supervisor blamed high turnover on former employees instead of seeing the real problem.  Pretended to listen to concerns but it was lip service.  
Some doctors were very nice but others were demanding and disrespectful.  They weren't Munson employees so there was no accountability.  
Terrible parking situation.  Forget getting into the parking garage unless you work 1st shift.  Overflow lots are 1/8 mile from building.  
Nepotism goes unchecked.
Bullying goes unchecked.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Traverse City, MI
pros: The colleagues were kind, helpful, and got their jobs done.
cons: As a nursing assistant looking to gain experience for an advanced practitioner position, I was disappointed in the pay at Munson compared to the pay at nearby nursing homes.  While the experience was most important for me, the salary was a deterrent.  There was also a large amount of reliability on overtime.  While it was nice to have the extra pay, it was apparent that they should have hired more staff.

job_title: Spiritual Caregiver
pros: I work at Munson Healthcare Grayling Hospital and it is a good place to work. My fellow employees are friendly and social. I also work another career and they are supportive of working with my other schedule.
cons: I would like to see interest taken in me. I work hard, smart and go up and above what's required but I have not been considered for advancement.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Traverse City, MI
pros: Patient care and safety are #1. Administration and Management keep connected to all staff at any level of employment
cons: The saying goes " A view of the Bay is worth have the pay", simply put you won't make as much as you would in a big city.

job_title: in Traverse City, MI
pros: Colleagues are generally helpful and friendly. The area is beautiful. You do need to like winter and winter activities.
cons: Largest employer in the area, with all that that implies. Monopoly over most aspects of health care. Part owner of one of the local medical insurance companies.

review_title: Might as well work for the government
job_title: IT Professional in Traverse City, MI
pros: Low stress, good hours, decent cafeteria, one of the only places to work in Traverse City besides a restaurant
cons: Lots of slackers, hard work often not rewarded, everyone gets the same raise regardless of performance

job_title: Pharmacy Tech I/Clerk in Traverse City, MI
pros: Great flexibility, family oriented. They tried very hard to work with each person and promote within. Yearly raises and great benefits package.
cons: Great place to work. Sometimes management was lacking on serious issues but eventually issues were taken care of. Munson overall is great though. Was hard to switch to different departments.

review_title: Eveything is "Managers discretion"? You can and will be targeted!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Traverse, MI
pros:
By far it's some of the people! 
Most of the nurses are amazing.
cons:
Pay scale is ridiculous and there is no compensation for dedication. NO PROTECTION for employees! Managers can and will target you and get rid of you and can do so based on their "discretion"
 Munson medical center never has had an employee advocacy process in place. A manager can write you up regardless of true or not. If you work for NMSA at MMC A company which is partially owned by Munson healthcare  I feel sorry for you a manager in that department is disgraceful, she has targeted many employees and written several staff members up based on hearsay completely unprofessional in every sense of the word.   If you speak up or make  A complaint there will be retribution. 
 The HR  department at MMC is a joke. 
 They claim they are neutral however less than 1% of grievances filed by employees are ever resolved in the employees favor!
MMC HR is there for the management. They are not there for the employee if you are ever asked to go to HR it's like leading a pig to slaughter!  Munson medical center has gotten so big and has become such an monopoly that they no longer care about their employees.  They spend a ton of money on advertising and yet they can't keep staff?  Bottom line is managers have way too much power they will pick and choose not based upon performance but whether they like you or not? In other words you could be a dedicated hard-working loyal employee what if your manager does not like you she will write you up for things that others do on a daily basis it's a disgrace and a shame and should not be tolerated.  MMC simply hides behind their policies and claims all of their managers have integrity and dignity? 
 If you work for any Munson healthcare agency do not speak up the matter how much they encourage you to do so! Ultimately it comes down to the manager you work for and to put blinders on and pretend  that all managers treat employees with dignity and respect is just foolish. 
 The bottom line is you have no recourse a manager can accuse you of anything and I mean anything based on nothing more than what they heard and you will be written up.  Until there is a union in place to protect the employees there this practice will continue. If MMC does not want to union then they should strongly look at employee advocacy's system were a peer represents you when having to appear  like a pig going to slaughter in the HR department.

job_title: Manager in Traverse, MI
pros: Great people to work with and the area is nice to raise a family.
cons: I am less employable than I was when I started. The hospital is behind the times and always over budget. Many leaders have been there to long, and lack vision of the future. They are currently downsizing in order to meet future budget.

job_title: Field Paramedic in Traverse, MI
pros: Boy right now I'm  having a hard time coming up with anything.
cons: Leadership is absent and management presence in silent. Employee morale is in the tank. Employees are routinely asked and expected to 70+ hours weekly and it is an every day occurrence to have individuals operating on zero sleep in a 24 period after running all night. Pay is below industry average and quality medics are leaving every week with no one wanting to sign up. Healthcare ins. through Munson is terrible and they contribute less than 2% to retirement.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Traverse, MI
pros: Patient experience, passionate coworkers, part-time benefits
cons: Management is absolutely terrible in the behavioral health departments. Always understaffed because they won't support employees forcing people to quit out of pure misery. I quit during a pandemic because I'd rather be broke and without insurance than work for them ever again. I went from mental health to the addiction unit and both were shockingly miserable to work for. Management is extremely manipulative and is constantly lying. They are untrustworthy and there is no point in discussing issues/complaints. Employees are just a number and a person to fill a patient to staff quota. They will pull you to wherever they need you, without proper training, and despite the fact that you were hired for a specific unit. They will also hire overqualified people for the lowest position available to cut costs saying they hire "based on experience", however, never allow you to move up. When they need someone to fill a higher position instead of looking within, they hire out for a person with minimum job requirements so they can pay them less. Be prepared for an 18 cent raise each year. The disrespect and lack of support for employees is unbelievable. Munson is lucky to have such an amazing staff who is passionate about helping people who suffer from mental illnesses. It's the only reason why D6 (center 1) and outpatient is surviving.

job_title: Accounts Receivable in Traverse City, MI
pros: Good salary, great benefits, flexible hours and it's a teaching atmosphere, we are all students, no one is better or worse than someone else.  We are all learning
cons: Management doesn't always hear the employee suggestions and they leap into big projects without asking for employee feedback.  They need to look at the overall value of a project.

job_title: Unit Clerk in Traverse City, MI
pros: Great work/life balance. Good benefits if you are full time. Good growth opportunities to move up.
cons: Unaffordable insurance if you are a part time employee needing coverage for a family. No discounts in cafeteria for employees who sometimes get mandates to work extra shifts.

job_title: Physician, Infectious Disease in Traverse City, MI
pros: Female coworker in lab assulted by coworker c.r., but nothing done.  Male coworker had to escort other females around lab due to uncomfortable environment that many females experienced.
cons: Integrity,  honor, and respect no longer represents this previously solid establishment .  Cadillac still a good place, but when reported abuse told to president and nothing happens...  wow. That is a new standard of sad

review_title: Great place to work with dedicated employees

review_title: Great place to work and serve your community.

job_title: Medical Technologist in Grayling, MI
pros: The techs at the facilities I worked at were not only smart, but cared a great deal about giving out good lab results. They also try to stay updated with materials and procedures.
cons: As with most hospitals there is a small degree of drama between hospitals.

job_title: Staff Accountant in Traverse City, MI

cons: The pay is on the lower end and advancement takes time.
